{{title|SIGTERM, SIGSEGV, SIGINT, SIGILL, SIGABRT, SIGFPE}}
{{cpp/utility/program/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|csignal}}
{{dcl|
#define SIGTERM /*implementation defined*/
}}
{{dcl|
#define SIGSEGV /*implementation defined*/
}}
{{dcl|
#define SIGINT /*implementation defined*/
}}
{{dcl|
#define SIGILL /*implementation defined*/
}}
{{dcl|
#define SIGABRT /*implementation defined*/
}}
{{dcl|

}}
{{dcl end}}

Each of the above macro constants expands to an integer constant expression with distinct values, which represent different signals sent to the program.

{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc hitem|Constant|Explanation}}
{{dsc|{{tt|SIGTERM}}|termination request, sent to the program}}
{{dsc|{{tt|SIGSEGV}}|invalid memory access (segmentation fault)}}
{{dsc|{{tt|SIGINT}}|external interrupt, usually initiated by the user}}
{{dsc|{{tt|SIGILL}}|invalid program image, such as invalid instruction}}
{{dsc|{{tt|SIGABRT}}|abnormal termination condition, as is e.g. initiated by {{lc|std::abort()}}}}
{{dsc|{{tt|SIGFPE}}|erroneous arithmetic operation such as divide by zero}}
{{dsc end}}

===Notes===
Additional signal names [https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/basedefs/signal.h.html are specified by POSIX].
